04530  *
04531  * \description
04532  *
04533  *    The number of data points will be equal to the number of
04534  *    mesh subentities that the variable is associated with.
04535  *    NumComponent is the number of values per point. The total
04536  *    number of data values is numDataPoint * numComponent;
04537  *
04538  * \modifications  
04539  *     - Nancy Collins, Created.
04540  *     - 12/11/03 RM, added default return numDataPoint = -1, and input check 
04541  *               for numDataPoint = NULL
04542  */
04543 FC_ReturnCode fc_getVariableNumDataPoint(
04544   FC_Variable variable,    /**< input - variable handle */
04545   int *numDataPoint        /**< output - count of data items */
04546 ) { 
04547   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot;
04548   
04549   // set default values
04550   if(numDataPoint != NULL)
04551     *numDataPoint = -1;
04552   
04553   // check input
04554   varSlot = _fc_getVarSlot(variable);
04555   if (varSlot == NULL || numDataPoint == NULL) {
04556     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04557     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04558   }
04559   
04560   // log message
04561   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting numDataPoint for variable '%s'", 
04562                       varSlot->header.name);
04563 
04564   // fill in requested value
04565   *numDataPoint = varSlot->numDataPoint;
04566   
04567   return FC_SUCCESS;
04568 }
04569 
04570 //@}
04571 
04572 /** \name Get variable big data. */
04573 //-------------------------------
04574 //@{
04575 
04576 /**
04577  * \ingroup  Variable
04578  * \brief  Get the data in a variable.
04579  *
04580  * \description
04581  *  
04582  *    Return a pointer to the data array.  This must be treated as read-only.  
04583  *    If the user wants to change the data they must make a copy first.
04584  *
04585  *    Can also be used to get the data in a step of a sequence variable
04586  *    by calling with the variable handle for the desired step.
04587  *
04588  * \modifications  
04589  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
04590  */
04591 FC_ReturnCode fc_getVariableDataPtr(
04592  FC_Variable variable,  /**< input - variable  */
04593  void **data_p          /**< output - pointer to data array, treat as read only */
04594 ) {
04595   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04596   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot;
04597   
04598   // default
04599   if (data_p)
04600     *data_p = NULL;
04601   
04602   // check input
04603   varSlot = _fc_getVarSlot(variable);
04604   if (varSlot == NULL || data_p == NULL) {
04605     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04606     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04607   }
04608   
04609   // log message
04610   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting data for variable '%s'", varSlot->header.name);
04611 
04612   // lazy fetching of data done here
04613   if (varSlot->data == NULL && varSlot->header.committed == 1) {
04614     rc = _fc_readVariableData(variable);
04615     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04616       fc_printfErrorMessage("Lazy loading of data for variable '%s' failed",
04617                             varSlot->header.name);
04618       return rc;
04619     }
04620   }
04621 
04622   // fill in requested value
04623   *data_p = varSlot->data;
04624   
04625   return FC_SUCCESS;
04626 }
04627 
04628 /**
04629  * \ingroup  Variable
04630  * \brief  Get a copy of a variable's data as the requested data type.
04631  *
04632  * \description
04633  *
04634  *    Returns the variable's data as the type requested by the user.
04635  *    The user is responsible for freeing the array. This routine casts
04636  *    to the requested user type so there is a potential for lost information
04637  *    (e.g. if you cast a floating point number to int it is truncated, not
04638  *    rounded).
04639  *
04640  *    If you are worried about memory or casting, you should use
04641  *    fc_getVariableDataPtr() to get a pointer to the raw data array.
04642  *
04643  *    Can also be used to get the data in a step of a sequence variable
04644  *    by calling with the variable handle for the desired step.
04645  *
04646  * \modifications  
04647  *    - 02/02/05 WSK created.
04648  */
04649 FC_ReturnCode fc_getVariableDataAsDataType(
04650  FC_Variable variable,  /**< input - variable  */
04651  FC_DataType dataType,  /**< input - the data type for the returned data */
04652  void **data            /**< output - returned data */
04653 ) {
04654   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04655   int i;
04656   int numDataPoint, numComp, numTotal;
04657   FC_DataType dataType_orig;
04658   void *data_orig;
04659   
04660   // default
04661   if (data)
04662     *data = NULL;
04663   
04664   // check input
04665   if (!fc_isVariableValid(variable) || !fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) || 
04666       dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || data == NULL) {
04667     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04668     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04669   }
04670   
04671   // log message
04672   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting data for variable '%s' as type %s", 
04673                       _fc_getVarSlot(variable)->header.name,
04674                       fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
04675 
04676   // get variable info and data
04677   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(variable, &numDataPoint, &numComp, NULL, 
04678                           NULL, &dataType_orig);
04679   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04680     return rc;
04681   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(variable, &data_orig);
04682   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04683     return rc;
04684   numTotal = numDataPoint*numComp;
04685   
04686   // allocate return array
04687   *data = malloc(numTotal*fc_sizeofDataType(dataType));
04688   if (!*data) {
04689     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04690     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04691   }
04692 
04693   // special case - the same data type
04694   if (dataType == dataType_orig) {
04695     memcpy(*data, data_orig, numTotal*fc_sizeofDataType(dataType));
04696     return FC_SUCCESS;
04697   }
04698 
04699   // Fun!
04700   if (dataType == FC_DT_CHAR) {
04701     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
04702       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04703         ((char*)(*data))[i] = ((int*)data_orig)[i];
04704     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
04705       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04706         ((char*)(*data))[i] = ((float*)data_orig)[i];
04707     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
04708       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04709         ((char*)(*data))[i] = ((double*)data_orig)[i];
04710   }
04711   else if (dataType == FC_DT_INT) {
04712     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
04713       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04714         ((int*)(*data))[i] = ((char*)data_orig)[i];
04715     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
04716       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04717         ((int*)(*data))[i] = ((float*)data_orig)[i];
04718     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
04719       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04720         ((int*)(*data))[i] = ((double*)data_orig)[i];
04721   }
04722   else if (dataType == FC_DT_FLOAT) {
04723     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
04724       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04725         ((float*)(*data))[i] = ((char*)data_orig)[i];
04726     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
04727       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04728         ((float*)(*data))[i] = ((int*)data_orig)[i];
04729     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
04730       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04731         ((float*)(*data))[i] = ((double*)data_orig)[i];
04732   }
04733   else if (dataType == FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
04734     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
04735       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04736         ((double*)(*data))[i] = ((char*)data_orig)[i];
04737     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
04738       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04739         ((double*)(*data))[i] = ((int*)data_orig)[i];
04740     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
04741       for (i = 0; i < numTotal; i++)
04742         ((double*)(*data))[i] = ((float*)data_orig)[i];
04743   }
04744   
04745   return FC_SUCCESS;
04746 }
04747 
04748 
04749 /**\ingroup Variable
04750  * \brief  In a sequence variable, get data for steps at a single data point
04751  *         returned as a sequence variable with association FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH
04752  *
04753  * \description
04754  *
04755  *    Given a sequence variable and the id of a particular data point
04756  *    (corresponds to a particular entity id for the variable), this will
04757  *    return a seqvar with data values for that point only with association
04758  *    FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH. This method calls fc_getVariableDataPointSlice and then
04759  *    packs the return array into a sequence Variable.
04760  *
04761  * \modifications  
04762  *    - 2/10/05 ACG, Created.
04763  */
04764 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSeqVariableDataPointSliceAsSeqVariable(
04765  int numStep,         /**< input - number of steps in the sequence variable */ 
04766  FC_Variable* seqVar, /**< input - seq variable handles  */
04767  int dataPointID,     /**< input - ID of the data point/entity of interest */
04768  char* slicevarname,    /**< input - name of output seqvar */
04769  FC_Variable** sliceVar /**< output - output seqvar */
04770 ) {
04771   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04772   FC_Mesh mesh;
04773   FC_Sequence seq;
04774 
04775   int numComponent;
04776   FC_MathType mathtype;
04777   FC_DataType datatype;
04778   FC_AssociationType assoc;
04779 
04780   void* history;
04781   void* dcounter;
04782   int i;
04783 
04784   //only need to check slicevar, fc_getSeqVariableDataPointSlice checks the
04785   //rest
04786 
04787   if (sliceVar)
04788     *sliceVar = NULL;
04789 
04790   if (sliceVar == NULL || slicevarname == NULL){
04791     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04792     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04793   };
04794 
04795   //get data & its does input checks
04796   rc = fc_getSeqVariableDataPointSlice(numStep,seqVar, dataPointID, &history);
04797   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04798     return rc;
04799   }
04800 
04801 
04802   // Get info about seq variable
04803   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(seqVar[0], NULL, &numComponent, &assoc, &mathtype,
04804                           &datatype);
04805   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04806     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(rc));
04807     free(history);
04808     return rc;
04809   }
04810 
04811   //make slice var
04812   rc = fc_getMeshFromVariable(seqVar[0],&mesh);
04813   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep,seqVar,&seq);
04814   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04815     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(rc));
04816     free(history);
04817     return rc;
04818   }
04819 
04820   rc = fc_createSeqVariable(mesh, seq, slicevarname, &numStep,sliceVar);
04821   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04822       fc_deleteSeqVariable(numStep,*sliceVar);
04823       free(*sliceVar);
04824       *sliceVar = NULL;
04825       free(history);
04826       return rc;
04827   }
04828 
04829   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++){
04830     switch (datatype){
04831     case FC_DT_INT:
04832       dcounter = &(((int*)history)[i*numComponent]);
04833       break;
04834     case FC_DT_FLOAT:
04835       dcounter = &(((float*)history)[i*numComponent]);
04836       break;
04837     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
04838       dcounter = &(((double*)history)[i*numComponent]);
04839       break;
04840     case FC_DT_CHAR:
04841       dcounter = &(((char*)history)[i*numComponent]);
04842       break;
04843     default:
04844       printf("** Developer Alert! Should never reach this point!**\n");
04845       fflush(NULL);
04846       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", "Invalid data type");
04847       return FC_ERROR;
04848       break;
04849     }
04850 
04851     rc = fc_setVariableData((*sliceVar)[i],1,numComponent,
04852                             FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH,mathtype,
04853                             datatype,dcounter);
04854     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04855       fc_deleteSeqVariable(numStep,*sliceVar);
04856       free(*sliceVar);
04857       *sliceVar = NULL;
04858       free(history);
04859       return rc;
04860     }
04861   }
04862 
04863   dcounter = NULL;
04864   free(history);
04865   return FC_SUCCESS;
04866 }
04867 
04868 
04869 /**
04870  * \ingroup  Variable
04871  * \brief  In a sequence variable, get data for steps at a single data.
04872  *
04873  * \description
04874  *
04875  *    Given a sequence variable and the id of a particular data point
04876  *    (corresponds to a particular entity id for the variable), this will
04877  *    return an array of data values at that point for each step in the
04878  *    sequence. This type of information for time series is often called a
04879  *    point history. If the data has more than one component, the array will be
04880  *    interleaved; that is, for each step all components will be listed before
04881  *    the next step (e.g.  Step1Comp1 Step2Comp2 .. Step1CompN ... StepMComp1
04882  *    StepMCompN).
04883  *
04884  *    This routine returns an allocated data array.  The user is responsible 
04885  *    for freeing it.
04886  *
04887  * \modifications  
04888  *    - 10/21/04 WSK, Created.
04889  */
04890 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSeqVariableDataPointSlice(
04891  int numStep,         /**< input - number of steps in the sequence variable */ 
04892  FC_Variable* seqVar, /**< input - seq variable handles  */
04893  int dataPointID,     /**< input - ID of the data point/entity of interest */
04894  void **history       /**< output - data array */
04895 ) {
04896   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04897   int i;
04898   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot;
04899   size_t size;
04900   int numDataPoint, numComp;
04901   FC_DataType dataType;
04902   void* temp_data, *data_p;
04903 
04904   // default
04905   if (history)
04906     *history = NULL;
04907   
04908   // check input
04909   if (!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep, seqVar) || dataPointID < 0 ||
04910       !history) {
04911     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04912     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04913   }
04914 
04915   // Get info about seq variable
04916   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(seqVar[0], &numDataPoint, &numComp, NULL, NULL,
04917                           &dataType);
04918   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04919     return rc;
04920 
04921   // a little more checking
04922   if (dataPointID >= numDataPoint) {
04923     fc_printfErrorMessage("Data point ID is outside range");
04924     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04925   }
04926 
04927   // log message
04928   varSlot = _fc_getVarSlot(seqVar[0]);
04929   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting history for seq variable '%s'", 
04930                       varSlot->header.name);
04931 
04932   // Collect history data
04933   size = numComp * fc_sizeofDataType(dataType);
04934   temp_data = malloc(numStep*size);
04935   if (temp_data == NULL) {
04936     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04937     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04938   }
04939   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
04940     rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(seqVar[i], &data_p);
04941     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04942       free(temp_data);
04943       return rc;
04944     }
04945     memcpy((char*)temp_data + i*size, (char*)data_p + dataPointID*size, size);
04946   }
04947 
04948   // set return   
04949   *history = temp_data;
04950 
04951   return FC_SUCCESS;
04952 }
04953 
04954 //@}
04955 
04956 /** \name Print variable. */
04957 //-------------------------------
04958 //@{
04959 
04960 /**
04961  * \ingroup  Variable
04962  * \brief Print variable meta data to stdout, and optionally the data values.
04963  *
04964  * \modifications 
04965  *    - Nancy Collins  Created.
04966  *    - 11/20/2003 WSK Fixed up. Want to replace a bunch of
04967  *                     specific print routines (like printSurfaceNormals).
04968  *    - 10/31/2007 CDU Added flag to allow printing of reduced number of digits
04969  */
04970 FC_ReturnCode fc_printVariable(
04971   FC_Variable variable, /**< input - data variable */
04972   char* label,          /**< input - label to prepend variable name with, 
04973                                      can be NULL */
04974   int print_data        /**< input - 1 = print the data values. 
04975                                      2 = print the data values in exponent form with 5 digits of precision */
04976 ) {
04977   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04978   int i, j;
04979   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot;
04980   int numDataPoint, numComp;
04981   FC_AssociationType assoc;
04982   FC_MathType mathType;
04983   FC_DataType dataType;
04984   void* dbuf;
04985 
04986   // special case: printing a null handle is not an error
04987   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(variable, FC_NULL_VARIABLE)) {
04988     printf("Variable: FC_NULL_VARIABLE\n");
04989     fflush(NULL);
04990     return FC_SUCCESS;
04991   }
04992 
04993   // check input
04994   varSlot = _fc_getVarSlot(variable);
04995   if (varSlot == NULL) {
04996     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04997     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04998   }
04999 
05000   // log message
05001   fc_printfLogMessage("Printing variable '%s'", varSlot->header.name);
05002 
05003   // print label & var name
05004   if (label)
05005     printf("%s: ", label);
05006   else
05007     printf("Variable: ");
05008   printf("'%s'\n", varSlot->header.name);
05009 
05010   // print meta data
05011   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(variable, &numDataPoint, &numComp, &assoc, 
05012                             &mathType, &dataType);
05013   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
05014     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for variable '%s'",
05015                           varSlot->header.name);
05016     return rc;
05017   }
05018   printf("%snumDataPoint = %d, numComponent = %d\n", INDENT_STR, 
05019          numDataPoint, numComp);
05020   printf("%sassoc = %s, mathType = %s, dataType = %s\n", INDENT_STR, 
05021          fc_getAssociationTypeText(assoc), fc_getMathTypeText(mathType), 
05022          fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
05023 
05024   // print values
05025   if (print_data) {
05026     rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(variable, &dbuf);
05027     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
05028       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get data for variable '%s'",
05029                             varSlot->header.name);
05030       return FC_ERROR;
05031     }
05032     
05033     // print the data 
05034     printf("%sData:\n", INDENT_STR);
05035     switch (dataType) {
05036     case FC_DT_CHAR: 
05037       {
05038         char* cast_buf = (char *)dbuf;
05039         for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05040           printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05041           for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05042             printf("%c ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05043           printf("\n");
05044         }
05045       }
05046       break;
05047     case FC_DT_INT:
05048       {
05049         int* cast_buf = (int *)dbuf;
05050         for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05051           printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05052           for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05053             printf("%6d ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05054           printf("\n");
05055         }
05056       }
05057       break;
05058     case FC_DT_FLOAT:
05059       {
05060         float* cast_buf = (float *)dbuf;
05061         for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05062           printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05063           for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05064             printf("%11.6g ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05065           printf("\n");
05066         }
05067       }
05068       break;
05069     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
05070       {
05071         double* cast_buf = (double *)dbuf;
05072         for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05073           printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05074           for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05075             //Should be 15 significant digits but there were
05076             //differences between Mac and Linux (sun same as Mac)
05077             //these may be due to rounding differences in printf()
05078             //printf("%20.15g ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05079          switch(print_data){
05080          case 2:  printf("%.5le ",   cast_buf[i*numComp + j]); break;
05081          default: printf("%16.11g ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]); break;
05082          }
05083           printf("\n");
05084         }
05085       }
05086       break;
05087     case FC_DT_UNKNOWN:
05088       printf("Cannot print data type '%s'\n", fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
05089     }
05090   }
05091 
05092   return FC_SUCCESS;
05093 }
05094 
05095 /**
05096  * \ingroup  Variable
05097  * \brief Print sequence variable meta data to stdout, and optionally the 
05098  *        data values.
05099  *
05100  * \modifications 
05101  *    - 11/20/03 WSK Created.
05102  *    - 07/23/2007 CDU Turned into a stub that calls fc_printSeqVariableRange
05103  */
05104 FC_ReturnCode fc_printSeqVariable(
05105   int numStep,        /**< input - number of steps in the sequence variable */
05106   FC_Variable* seqVars, /**< input - the steps of the sequence variable */
05107   char* label,          /**< input - label to prepend variable name with, 
05108                                      can be NULL */
05109   int print_data        /**< input - 1 = print the data values. */
05110 ) {
05111   return fc_printSeqVariableRange(numStep, seqVars, -1, -2, label, print_data);
05112 }
05113 /**
05114  * \ingroup  Variable
05115  * \brief Print sequence variable meta data to stdout, and optionally the 
05116  *        data values (with start and stop index values)
05117  *
05118  * \modifications 
05119  *    - 11/20/03   WSK Created.
05120  *    - 07/23/2007 CDU Moved guts of printSeqVariable to here and added ranges
05121  *    - 10/31/2007 CDU Added flag to allow printing of reduced number of digits
05122  */
05123 FC_ReturnCode fc_printSeqVariableRange(
05124   int numStep,        /**< input - number of steps in the sequence variable */
05125   FC_Variable* seqVars, /**< input - the steps of the sequence variable */
05126   int range_start,      /**< input - offset of first variable to print  
05127                                       or -1 for first, -2 for last */
05128   int range_stop,       /**< input - offset of last variable to print 
05129                                       or -1 for first, -2 for last */
05130   char* label,          /**< input - label to prepend variable name with, 
05131                                      can be NULL */
05132   int print_data        /**< input - 1 = print the data values.
05133                                      2 = print the data values in exponent form with 5 digits of precision */
05134 ) {
05135   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05136   int i, j, k;
05137   _FC_VarSlot* varSlots[numStep];
05138   int numDataPoint, numComp;
05139   FC_AssociationType assoc;
05140   FC_MathType mathType;
05141   FC_DataType dataType;
05142   void* dbuf;
05143   int start, stop, mod;
05144 
05145   // special case: printing a null list is not an error
05146   if (numStep <= 0 && seqVars == NULL) {
05147     fc_printfWarningMessage("Printing a NULL sequence variable");
05148     printf("Sequence Variable: FC_NULL_VARIABLE\n");
05149     return FC_SUCCESS;
05150   }
05151 
05152   // check input
05153   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
05154     varSlots[i] = _fc_getVarSlot(seqVars[i]);
05155     if (varSlots[i] == NULL) {
05156       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05157       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05158     }
05159   }
05160 
05161   // log message
05162   fc_printfLogMessage("Printing variable '%s'", varSlots[0]->header.name);
05163 
05164   // print label & var name
05165   if (label)
05166     printf("%s: ", label);
05167   else
05168     printf("Sequence Variable: ");
05169   printf("'%s'\n", varSlots[0]->header.name);
05170 
05171   // print meta data
05172   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(seqVars[0], &numDataPoint, &numComp, &assoc, 
05173                             &mathType, &dataType);
05174   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
05175     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for seq variable '%s'",
05176                           varSlots[0]->header.name);
05177     return rc;
05178   }
05179   printf("%snumDataPoint = %d, numComponent = %d, numStep = %d\n", INDENT_STR, 
05180          numDataPoint, numComp, numStep);
05181   printf("%sassoc = %s, mathType = %s, dataType = %s\n", INDENT_STR, 
05182          fc_getAssociationTypeText(assoc), fc_getMathTypeText(mathType), 
05183          fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
05184 
05185 
05186   // print values
05187   if ((print_data) && (numStep)) {
05188 
05189     //Handle special case where start/stop are the first/last steps
05190     if(range_start<0){
05191       start = (range_start==-2) ? numStep-1 : 0;
05192     } else {
05193       start = (range_start>numStep-1) ? numStep-1 : range_start;
05194     }
05195     if(range_stop<0){
05196       stop = (range_stop==-2) ? numStep-1 : 0;
05197     } else {
05198       stop = (range_stop>numStep-1) ? numStep-1 : range_stop;
05199     }
05200 
05201     //Calculate the step size's direction
05202     mod   = (start<=stop)   ? 1 : -1;
05203 
05204     for(k=start; (mod>0) ? (k<=stop) : (k>=stop) ; k+= mod){
05205 
05206       rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(seqVars[k], &dbuf);
05207       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
05208         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get data for step %d of seq variable"
05209                               " '%s'", k, varSlots[0]->header.name);
05210         return FC_ERROR;
05211       }
05212       
05213       // print the data 
05214       printf("%sData (Step %d of seqVar '%s'):\n", INDENT_STR, 
05215              k, varSlots[0]->header.name);
05216       switch (dataType) {
05217       case FC_DT_CHAR: 
05218         {
05219           char* cast_buf = (char *)dbuf;
05220           for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05221             printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05222             for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05223               printf("%c ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05224             printf("\n");
05225           }
05226         }
05227         break;
05228       case FC_DT_INT:
05229         {
05230           int* cast_buf = (int *)dbuf;
05231           for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05232             printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05233             for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05234               printf("%6d ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05235             printf("\n");
05236           }
05237         }
05238         break;
05239       case FC_DT_FLOAT:
05240         {
05241           float* cast_buf = (float *)dbuf;
05242           for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05243             printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05244             for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05245               printf("%11.6g ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05246             printf("\n");
05247           }
05248         }
05249         break;
05250       case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
05251         {
05252           double* cast_buf = (double *)dbuf;
05253           for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
05254             printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
05255             for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
05256               // FIX? maybe %20.15g so always align
05257               //printf("%11.15g ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]);
05258            switch(print_data){
05259            case 2:  printf("%.5le ",   cast_buf[i*numComp + j]); break;
05260            default: printf("%11.15g ", cast_buf[i*numComp + j]); break;
05261            }
05262             printf("\n");
05263           }
05264         }
05265         break;
05266       case FC_DT_UNKNOWN:
05267         printf("Cannot print data type '%s'\n", fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
05268       }
05269     }
05270   }
05271 
05272   return FC_SUCCESS;
05273 }

05277 /**
05278  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05279  * \brief  Initialize a variable slot.
05280  *
05281  * \modifications  
05282  *   APR-30-2003  W Koegler  Created. 
05283  */
05284 void _fc_initVarSlot(
05285   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot    /**< input - the vtable slot to initialize */
05286 ) {
05287   if (varSlot != NULL) {
05288     _fc_initSlotHeader(&varSlot->header);
05289     varSlot->ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
05290     varSlot->mesh = FC_NULL_MESH;
05291     varSlot->sequence = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
05292     varSlot->stepID = -1;
05293     varSlot->numDataPoint = 0;
05294     varSlot->numComponent = 0;
05295     varSlot->mathtype = FC_MT_UNKNOWN;
05296     varSlot->datatype = FC_DT_UNKNOWN;
05297     varSlot->assoc = FC_AT_UNKNOWN;
05298     varSlot->data = NULL;
05299   }   
05300 }
05301 
05302 /**
05303  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05304  * \brief  Release non-necessary resources in a variable slot.
05305  *
05306  * \description
05307  *  
05308  *    Releases the data values.
05309  *
05310  * \modifications  
05311  *   Aug 6, 2002  W Koegler  Created
05312  */
05313 void _fc_releaseVarSlot(
05314   _FC_VarSlot* varSlotp       /**< input - vtable pointer */
05315 ) {
05316     // release big data
05317     if (varSlotp->data) {
05318       free(varSlotp->data);
05319       varSlotp->data = NULL;
05320     }
05321 
05322     return;
05323 }
05324 
05325 /**
05326  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05327  * \brief   Clear a variable slot.
05328  *
05329  * \description
05330  *
05331  *    Releases all dynamically allocated resources in a variable,
05332  *    and reinitializes all members.
05333  *
05334  * \modifications  
05335  *   - Aug 6, 2002  W Koegler  Created
05336  *   - 2003-APR-31  W Koegler  Made more comprehensive
05337  */
05338 void _fc_clearVarSlot(
05339  _FC_VarSlot* varSlotp       /**< input - vtable pointer */
05340 ) {
05341   if (varSlotp != NULL) {
05342     // free big data
05343     _fc_releaseVarSlot(varSlotp);
05344 
05345     // free other dynamic arrays, if any
05346 
05347     // clear table header
05348     _fc_clearSlotHeader(&varSlotp->header);
05349 
05350     // reinit
05351     _fc_initVarSlot(varSlotp);
05352   }
05353 }

05355 /**
05356  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05357  * \brief  Get the size of the variable table.
05358  *
05359  * \modifications  
05360  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
05361  */
05362 int _fc_getVarTableSize() {
05363   return varTableSize;
05364 }
05365 
05366 /**
05367  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05368  * \brief   Get an empty variable slot from the variable table.
05369  *
05370  * \description
05371  *  
05372  *    Will return a new slot or NULL. A NULL means a memory error occurred.
05373  *
05374  * \modifications  
05375  *    - 2003-MAY-01  W Koegler  Created
05376  *    - 12/08/03 WSK Changed because changed XTables from arrays of slots
05377  *      to arrays of handles to slots. The _fc_new_XSlot() routines do
05378  *      not call a common helper routine anymore.
05379  *    - 5/11/04 WSK  Moved common code from _fc_getNewDsSlot(), 
05380  *      _fc_getNewSeqSlot(), etc to _fc_getNewSlot().
05381  */
05382 _FC_VarSlot* _fc_getNewVarSlot() {
05383   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot;
05384 
05385   varSlot = (_FC_VarSlot*) _fc_getNewSlot(&varTableSize, 
05386                            (_FC_SlotHeader***)&varTable,
05387                            &varOpenSlots, sizeof(_FC_VarSlot));
05388   _fc_initVarSlot(varSlot);
05389 
05390   return varSlot;
05391 }
05392 
05393 /**
05394  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05395  *
05396  * \brief Get a variable slot from a variable handle.
05397  *
05398  * \description
05399  * 
05400  *    The slot id of the variable handle is used to find the
05401  *    the slot in the variable table. The identity is then
05402  *    verified by checking that the slot and the handle's
05403  *    uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot 
05404  *    is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.
05405  *
05406  * \modifications 
05407  *   - 2003-OCT-19  WSK  Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID 
05408  *      for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug
05409  *      prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
05410  *   - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
05411  */
05412 _FC_VarSlot* _fc_getVarSlot(
05413   FC_Variable variable    /**< input - variable */
05414 ) {
05415   if (_fc_isHandleValid(variable.slotID, variable.uID, varTableSize,
05416                         (_FC_SlotHeader**)varTable))
05417     return varTable[variable.slotID];
05418   else
05419     return NULL;
05420 }
05421 
05422 
05423 /**
05424  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05425  *
05426  * \brief Get a variable slot based on ID.
05427  *
05428  * \description
05429  * 
05430  *    The _FC_VarSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should
05431  *    only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want
05432  *    because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getVarSlot.
05433  *    The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and
05434  *    that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).
05435  *
05436  * \modifications 
05437  *    - 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into
05438  *      tables without knowing about them.
05439  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.
05440  */
05441 _FC_VarSlot* _fc_getVarSlotFromID(
05442   int varID
05443 ) {
05444   return (_FC_VarSlot*) _fc_getSlot(varID, varTableSize, 
05445                                    (_FC_SlotHeader**)varTable);
05446 }
05447 
05448 /**
05449  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05450  * \brief Delete the variable slot associated with the variable handle.
05451  *
05452  * \description 
05453  *    
05454  *    This routine clears the dynamic data in the slot and then
05455  *    deletes the slot from the table.
05456  *
05457  * \modifications
05458  *   - 12/20/2005 WSD. Created.
05459  */
05460 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteVarSlot(
05461   FC_Variable variable    /**< input - variable */
05462 ) {
05463   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot;
05464   
05465   varSlot = _fc_getVarSlot(variable);
05466   if (varSlot == NULL) {
05467     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05468     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05469   }
05470 
05471   // do it
05472   _fc_clearVarSlot(varSlot);
05473   return _fc_deleteSlot(varSlot->header.slotID, varTableSize, 
05474                (_FC_SlotHeader**)varTable, &varOpenSlots);
05475 }
05476 
05477 /**
05478  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05479  * \brief  Print the contents of the Variable Table (varTable) to stderr.
05480  *
05481  * \description
05482  *
05483  *    Prints the contents of the Variable Table in a human readable form.
05484  *    It takes a string to use as a label for this print out of the table.
05485  *    Pass NULL if you don't want a label.
05486  *
05487  * \modifications 
05488  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
05489  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Fixed up.
05490  */
05491 void _fc_printVarTable(
05492   char *label     /**< Input - label for this version the table (without a
05493                            trailing \\n) pass NULL if no label is desired */
05494 ) {
05495   int i;
05496   _FC_VarSlot* varSlot;
05497   
05498   // print table heading
05499   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
05500   fprintf(stderr, "Variable Table (varTable):\n");
05501   if (label != NULL)
05502     fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", label);
05503   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
05504   fflush(NULL);
05505   
05506   // We're done if it's empty
05507   if (varTableSize < 1) {
05508     fprintf(stderr, "(empty)\n");
05509     fprintf(stderr, "\n");
05510     fflush(NULL);
05511     return;
05512   }
05513 
05514   // print contents for each slot
05515   for (i = 0; i < varTableSize; i++) {
05516     varSlot = varTable[i];
05517     fprintf(stderr, "%3d: %s\n", i, (varSlot) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05518     if (varSlot == NULL)
05519       continue; 
05520     _fc_printSlotHeader(varSlot->header);
05521     fprintf(stderr, "     FC_Dataset = { %d, %d }, FC_Mesh = { %d, %d }\n",
05522             varSlot->ds.slotID, varSlot->ds.uID,
05523          varSlot->mesh.slotID, varSlot->mesh.uID);
05524     fprintf(stderr, "     FC_Sequence = { %d, %d }, stepID = %d\n",
05525             varSlot->sequence.slotID, varSlot->sequence.uID, varSlot->stepID);
05526     fprintf(stderr, "     numDataPoint = %d, numComponent = %d\n", 
05527             varSlot->numDataPoint, varSlot->numComponent);
05528     fprintf(stderr, "     association = %s, mathtype = %s\n",
05529             fc_getAssociationTypeText(varSlot->assoc),
05530             fc_getMathTypeText(varSlot->mathtype));
05531     fprintf(stderr, "     datatype = %s, data = %s\n", 
05532             fc_getDataTypeText(varSlot->datatype), 
05533             (varSlot->data) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05534   }
05535   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
05536   fflush(NULL);
05537   
05538   return;
05539 }
05540 
05541 /**
05542  * \ingroup  PrivateVariable
05543  * \brief  Free all entries in the variable table
05544  *
05545  * \description
05546  *
05547  *    This should only be called after making sure that
05548  *    all slots have been cleared.
05549  *
05550  * \modifications  
05551  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
05552  */
05553 void _fc_freeVarTable() {
05554   int i;
05555   for (i = 0; i < varTableSize; i++) {
05556     _fc_clearVarSlot(varTable[i]);
05557     free(varTable[i]);
05558   }
05559   free(varTable);
05560   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&varOpenSlots);
05561   varTableSize = 0;
05562   varTable = NULL;
05563 }
